title: SSH
description: SSH (Secure Shell) is a protocol for secure remote login and command execution.

snippets.Basic Connection:
# Connect to server
ssh user@hostname
ssh user@192.168.1.100

# Specify port
ssh -p 2222 user@hostname

# Verbose output
ssh -v user@hostname
snippets.Key Generation:
# Generate SSH key
ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "your_email@example.com"

# Generate ED25519 key (recommended)
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

# Specify file location
ssh-keygen -t rsa -f ~/.ssh/my_key
snippets.Copy Key to Server:
# Copy public key
ssh-copy-id user@hostname

# Specify key file
ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/my_key.pub user@hostname

# Manual copy
cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | ssh user@hostname "mkdir -p ~/.ssh && cat >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys"
snippets.Config File:
# ~/.ssh/config
Host myserver
    HostName 192.168.1.100
    User admin
    Port 2222
    IdentityFile ~/.ssh/my_key

# Usage
ssh myserver
snippets.File Transfer:
# Copy file to server
scp file.txt user@hostname:/path/to/destination

# Copy from server
scp user@hostname:/path/to/file.txt ./local/path

# Copy directory
scp -r folder user@hostname:/path/

# Using rsync
rsync -avz folder/ user@hostname:/path/
snippets.Port Forwarding:
# Local port forwarding
ssh -L 8080:localhost:80 user@hostname

# Remote port forwarding
ssh -R 8080:localhost:80 user@hostname

# Dynamic port forwarding (SOCKS proxy)
ssh -D 1080 user@hostname
snippets.Tunneling:
# SSH tunnel
ssh -N -L 3306:localhost:3306 user@hostname

# Background tunnel
ssh -f -N -L 3306:localhost:3306 user@hostname

# Keep alive
ssh -o ServerAliveInterval=60 user@hostname
snippets.Security:
# Disable password authentication
# In /etc/ssh/sshd_config:
PasswordAuthentication no

# Change default port
Port 2222

# Disable root login
PermitRootLogin no

# Restart SSH service
sudo systemctl restart sshd
